text:
While doing checkouts with cvsnt's extssh protocol Ant hangs halfway through a
checkout. Looking in the task manager cvs.exe is still active and upon
terminating it the Ant script resumes execution, but usually short a few files
from cvs. I have not been able to reliably reproduce the problem, but it affects
a number of our Ant scripts. The problem only occurs about every other time the
script is executed.

aproximate command being executed
<cvs cvsroot=":extssh:meyermc@xxxx.xxxxxx.org:/cvs/test" package="foo"
dest="C:\bar" failonerror="true"/>
creator: mordorian@charter.net

text:
Since ant's <cvs> task is merely a thin veneer on the cvs executable it is hard
to see how this is a problem in Ant, especially since terminating the cvs.exe
process causes Ant to resume. Ant is clearly waiting for the command to complete.

Can you look at the command line Ant is generating (use the -debug flag) and
then try this manually a few times. There are obviously many components which
may be affecting this - the server, the network setup, the ssh client, cvs.exe
and Ant.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
Probably ssh is waiting for you to inset your password or passphrase.

I'll assume this is the case and close the bug now, please reopen if the problem
seems to be a different one.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
